question: What is the ratio of the maximum width of the head of an organism multiplied by 100 divided by its maximum length called?
explanation: The shape of the head is expressed as an index of width of head divided by length, stated as a percentage. This index is called the cephalic index (C.I.). The long-headed people are called the Dolichocephalic, the mediumheaded are called the Mesocephalic and the broadheaded are called the Brachycephalic people
